statements.name: PROC HPFENGINE
statements.description: The HPFENGINE procedure provides an automatic way to generate forecasts for many time series or transactional data in one step. The procedure can automatically choose the best forecast model from a user-defined model list or a default model list. Specifications for the candidate forecast models are independent of any data series. You can generate the specifications or choose them from a default set.

arguments.name: BACK=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of observations before the end of the data where the multistep forecasts are to begin.

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: names the SAS data set that contains the input data for the procedure to forecast.

arguments.name: ERRORCONTROL=
arguments.description: Prefixes the model specification file name or the model selection list file name or both.

arguments.name: EXCEPTIONS=
arguments.description: Specifies the desired handling of arithmetic exceptions during the run.

arguments.name: IGNORE
arguments.description: Specifies that PROC HPFENGINE stop on an arithmetic exception. No recovery is attempted.

arguments.name: CATCH
arguments.description: Specifies that PROC HPFENGINE generate a forecast for the current BY group.

arguments.name: ESM
arguments.description: Specifies that PROC HPFENGINE generate a forecast based on using its default exponential smoothing model for the variable that produces the arithmetic exception in the current BY group.

arguments.name: RW
arguments.description: Specifies that PROC HPFENGINE generate a forecast based on a zero-drift random walk model for the variable that produces the exception in the current BY group.

arguments.name: MISSING
arguments.description: Specifies that PROC HPFENGINE generate a forecast of missing values for the variable that produces the exception in the current BY group.

arguments.name: GLOBALSELECTION=
arguments.description: Specifies the name of a catalog entry that serves as a model selection list.

arguments.name: IGNORECHOOSE
arguments.description: Specifies that the CHOOSE= option in the HPFSELECT procedure be ignored when selecting a model in the candidate model list.

arguments.name: INEST=
arguments.description: Contains information that maps forecast variables to models or selection lists, and data set variables to model variables.

arguments.name: INEVENT=
arguments.description: Contains information that describes predefined events.

arguments.name: LEAD=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of periods ahead to forecast (forecast lead or horizon).

arguments.name: OUT=
arguments.description: Names the output data set to contain the forecasts of the variables specified in the subsequent FORECAST statements.

arguments.name: OUTCOMPONENT=
arguments.description: Names the output data set to contain the forecast components.

arguments.name: OUTEST=
arguments.description: Contains information that maps forecast variables to model specifications, and data set variables to model variables and parameter estimates.

arguments.name: OUTFOR=
arguments.description: Names the output data set to contain the forecast time series components (actual, predicted, lower confidence limit, upper confidence limit, prediction error, and prediction standard error).

arguments.name: OUTINDEP=
arguments.description: Names the output data set to contain input in the forecasting process.

arguments.name: OUTMODELINFO=
arguments.description: Names the output data set to contain detailed information about the selected forecast model.

arguments.name: OUTPROCINFO=
arguments.description: Names the output data set to contain information in the SAS log, specifically the number of notes, errors, and warnings and the number of series processed, forecasts requested, and forecasts failed.

arguments.name: OUTSTAT=
arguments.description: Names the output data set to contain the statistics of fit (or goodness-of-fit statistics).

arguments.name: OUTSTATSELECT=
arguments.description: Names the output data set to contain statistics of fit for all of the candidate models fit during model selection.

arguments.name: PLOT=
arguments.description: Specifies the graphical output desired. By default, the HPFENGINE procedure produces no graphical output.
arguments.help: PLOT=ERRORS | ACF | PACF | IACF | WN | FORECASTS | FORECASTCYCLES | FORECASTSONLY | COMPONENTS | CANDIDATES | ALL

arguments.name: ERRORS
arguments.description: Plots prediction error time series graphics.

arguments.name: ACF
arguments.description: Plots prediction error autocorrelation function graphics.

arguments.name: PACF
arguments.description: Plots prediction error partial autocorrelation function graphics.

arguments.name: IACF
arguments.description: Plots prediction error inverse autocorrelation function graphics.

arguments.name: WN
arguments.description: Plots white noise graphics.

arguments.name: FORECASTS
arguments.description: Plots forecast graphics.

arguments.name: FORECASTCYCLES
arguments.description: Plots forecast seasonal cycles graphics.

arguments.name: FORECASTSONLY
arguments.description: Plots the forecast in the forecast horizon only.

arguments.name: COMPONENTS
arguments.description: Plots the forecast components.

arguments.name: CANDIDATES
arguments.description: Plots model and error graphics for each candidate model fit to the series forecast series.

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: Specifies all of the preceding PLOT= options.

arguments.name: PRINT=
arguments.description: Specifies the printed output desired. By default, the HPFENGINE procedure produces no printed output.
arguments.help: PRINT=ESTIMATES | FORECASTS | STATISTICS | SUMMARY | PERFORMANCE | PERFORMANCESUMMARY | PERFORMANCEOVERALL | SELECT | BIAS | COMPONENTS | CANDIDATES | DESCSTATS | ALL

arguments.name: ESTIMATES
arguments.description: Prints the results of parameter estimation.

arguments.name: FORECASTS
arguments.description: Prints the forecasts.

arguments.name: STATISTICS
arguments.description: Prints the statistics of fit.

arguments.name: SUMMARY
arguments.description: Prints the forecast summary.

arguments.name: PERFORMANCE
arguments.description: Prints the performance statistics for each forecast.

arguments.name: PERFORMANCESUMMARY
arguments.description: Prints the performance summary for each BY group.

arguments.name: PERFORMANCEOVERALL
arguments.description: Prints the performance summary for all of the BY groups.

arguments.name: SELECT
arguments.description: Prints the label and fit statistics for each model in the selection list.

arguments.name: BIAS
arguments.description: Prints model bias information.

arguments.name: COMPONENTS
arguments.description: Prints forecast model components.

arguments.name: CANDIDATES
arguments.description: Prints parameter estimates for each candidate model fit to the series forecast series.

arguments.name: DESCSTATS
arguments.description: Prints descriptive statistics the series forecast series.

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: The same as specifying PRINT=(ESTIMATES SELECT FORECASTS STATISTICS BIAS DESCSTATS).

arguments.name: PRINTDETAILS
arguments.description: Specifies that output requested with the PRINT= option be printed in greater detail.

arguments.name: REPOSITORY=
arguments.description: Is a two-level SAS catalog name that specifies the location of the model repository.

arguments.name: SCOREREPOSITORY=
arguments.description: Is a two-level SAS catalog name that specifies the location of the model score repository.

arguments.name: SEASONALITY=
arguments.description: Specifies the length of the seasonal cycle.

arguments.name: SORTNAMES
arguments.description: Specifies the length of the seasonal cycle.

arguments.name: TASK=
arguments.description: Controls the model selection and parameter estimation process.

arguments.name: SELECT
arguments.description: Performs model selection, estimates parameters of the selected model, and produces forecasts.

arguments.name: FIT
arguments.description: Estimates parameters by using the model specified in the INEST= data set, then forecasts.

arguments.name: UPDATE
arguments.description: Estimates parameters by using the model specified in the INEST= data set, then forecasts.

arguments.name: FORECAST
arguments.description: Forecasts using model and parameters specified in the INEST= data set. No parameter estimation occurs.

statements.name: ADJUST
statements.description: The ADJUST statement lists the numeric variables in the DATA= data set whose accumulated values are used to adjust the dependent values. Adjustments can be performed before and/or after forecasting. A particular forecast variable can be referenced by multiple forecast statements.
statements.help: ADJUST <ACCUMULATE=<NONE | TOTAL | AVERAGE|AVG>... > <OPERATION=<NONE | ADD | SUBTRACT>... > <SETMISSING=<MISSING | AVERAGE|AVG | MINIMUM|MIN>... > ...

arguments.name: ACCUMULATE=
arguments.description: Specifies how the data set observations are accumulated within each time period for the variables listed in the ADJUST statement.
arguments.help: ACCUMULATE=NONE | TOTAL | AVERAGE | MINIMUM | MEDIAN | MAXIMUM | N | NMISS | NOBS | FIRST | LAST | STDDEV | CSS | USS*option*

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: None

arguments.name: TOTAL
arguments.description: Total

arguments.name: AVERAGE
arguments.description: Average

arguments.name: MINIMUM
arguments.description: Minimum

arguments.name: MEDIAN
arguments.description: Median

arguments.name: MAXIMUM
arguments.description: Maximum

arguments.name: N
arguments.description: N

arguments.name: NMISS
arguments.description: NMISS

arguments.name: NOBS
arguments.description: NOBS

arguments.name: FIRST
arguments.description: First

arguments.name: LAST
arguments.description: Last

arguments.name: STDDEV
arguments.description: STDDEV

arguments.name: CSS
arguments.description: CSS

arguments.name: USS
arguments.description: USS

arguments.name: OPERATION=
arguments.description: Specifies how the adjustments are applied to the forecast variable.
arguments.help: OPERATION=NONE | ADD | SUBTRACT | MULTIPLY | DIVIDE | MIN | MAX

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: No adjustment operation is performed. This is the default.

arguments.name: ADD
arguments.description: Variables listed in the adjustment statement are added to the dependent variable.

arguments.name: SUBTRACT
arguments.description: Variables listed in the adjustment statement are subtracted from the dependent variable.

arguments.name: MULTIPLY
arguments.description: Dependent variable is multiplied by variables listed in the adjustment statement.

arguments.name: DIVIDE
arguments.description: Dependent variable is divided by variables listed in the adjustment statement.

arguments.name: MIN
arguments.description: Dependent variable is set to the minimum of the dependent variable and all variables listed in the adjustment statement.

arguments.name: MAX
arguments.description: Dependent variable is set to the maximum of the dependent variable and all variables listed in the adjustment statement.

arguments.name: SETMISSING=
arguments.description: Specifies how missing values (either actual or accumulated) are assigned in the accumulated time series for variables listed in the ADJUST statement.
arguments.help: SETMISSING=MISSING | AVERAGE | MINIMUM | MEDIAN | MAXIMUM | FIRST | LAST | PREVIOUS | NEXT

arguments.name: MISSING
arguments.description: Missing

arguments.name: AVERAGE
arguments.description: Average

arguments.name: MINIMUM
arguments.description: Minimum

arguments.name: MEDIAN
arguments.description: Median

arguments.name: MAXIMUM
arguments.description: Maximum

arguments.name: FIRST
arguments.description: First

arguments.name: LAST
arguments.description: Last

arguments.name: PREVIOUS
arguments.description: Previous

arguments.name: NEXT
arguments.description: Next

arguments.name: TRIMMISS=
arguments.description: Specifies how missing values (either actual or accumulated) are trimmed from the accumulated time series for variables listed in the ADJUST statement.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: No missing value trimming is applied.

arguments.name: LEFT
arguments.description: Beginning missing values are trimmed.

arguments.name: RIGHT
arguments.description: Ending missing values are trimmed.

arguments.name: BOTH
arguments.description: Both beginning and ending missing value are trimmed.

arguments.name: ZEROMISS=
arguments.description: Specifies how beginning and/or ending zero values (either actual or accumulated) are interpreted in the accumulated time series for variables listed in the ADJUST statement.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: Beginning and/or ending zeros unchanged.

arguments.name: LEFT
arguments.description: Beginning zeros are set to missing.

arguments.name: RIGHT
arguments.description: Ending zeros are set to missing.

arguments.name: BOTH
arguments.description: Both beginning and ending zeros are set to missing.

statements.name: BY
statements.description: A BY statement can be used with PROC HPFENGINE to obtain separate dummy variable definitions for groups of observations defined by the BY variables.

arguments.name: DESCENDING
arguments.description: Specifies that the observations are sorted in descending order by the variable that immediately follows the word DESCENDING in the BY statement.

arguments.name: NOTSORTED
arguments.description: Specifies that observations are not necessarily sorted in alphabetic or numeric order.

statements.name: CONTROL
statements.description: The CONTROL statement lists the numeric variables in the DATA= data set whose accumulated values are used as input in the forecasting process.
statements.help: CONTROL <ACCUMULATE=<NONE | TOTAL | AVERAGE|AVG>... > <EXTEND=<NONE | AVERAGE | FIRST>... > <SETMISSING=<MISSING | AVERAGE|AVG | MINIMUM|MIN>... > ...

arguments.name: ACCUMULATE=
arguments.description: Specifies how the data set observations are accumulated within each time period for the variables listed in the CONTROL statement.
arguments.help: ACCUMULATE=NONE | TOTAL | AVERAGE | MINIMUM | MEDIAN | MAXIMUM | N | NMISS | NOBS | FIRST | LAST | STDDEV | CSS | USS*option*

arguments.name: EXTEND=
arguments.description: Specifies how future values of the control variables are set.
arguments.help: EXTEND=NONE | AVERAGE | FIRST | LAST | MINIMUM | MAXIMUM | MEDIAN*option*

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: Future values are set to missing.

arguments.name: AVERAGE
arguments.description: Future values are set to the mean of the values in the fit range. This is the default.

arguments.name: FIRST
arguments.description: Future values are set to the first value found in the fit range.

arguments.name: LAST
arguments.description: Future values are set to the last value found in the fit range.

arguments.name: MINIMUM
arguments.description: Future values are set to the minimum of the values in the fit range.

arguments.name: MAXIMUM
arguments.description: Future values are set to the maximum of the values in the fit range.

arguments.name: MEDIAN
arguments.description: Future values are set to the median of the values in the fit range.

arguments.name: SETMISSING=
arguments.description: Specifies how missing values (either actual or accumulated) are assigned in the accumulated time series for variables listed in the CONTROL statement.
arguments.help: SETMISSING=MISSING | AVERAGE | MINIMUM | MEDIAN | MAXIMUM | FIRST | LAST | PREVIOUS | NEXT

statements.name: EXTERNAL
statements.description: The EXTERNAL statement lists the numeric variables in the DATA= data set whose accumulated values are used as predicted values for an external model. It can also list prediction standard errors and lower and upper confidence intervals.
statements.help: EXTERNAL <SETMISSING=<MISSING | AVERAGE|AVG | MINIMUM|MIN>... > <TRIMMISS=<NONE | LEFT | RIGHT>... > <ZEROMISS=<NONE | LEFT | RIGHT>... > ...

arguments.name: SETMISSING=
arguments.description: Specifies how missing values (either actual or accumulated) are assigned in the accumulated time series for variables listed in the EXTERNAL statement.
arguments.help: SETMISSING=MISSING | AVERAGE | MINIMUM | MEDIAN | MAXIMUM | FIRST | LAST | PREVIOUS | NEXT

statements.name: FORECAST
statements.description: The FORECAST statement lists the numeric variables in the DATA= data set whose accumulated values represent time series to be modeled and forecast.

arguments.name: ACCUMULATE=
arguments.description: Specifies how the data set observations are accumulated within each time period for the variables listed in the FORECAST statement.
arguments.help: ACCUMULATE=NONE | TOTAL | AVERAGE | MINIMUM | MEDIAN | MAXIMUM | N | NMISS | NOBS | FIRST | LAST | STDDEV | CSS | USS*option*

arguments.name: NONE

arguments.name: NOREPLACE
arguments.description: specifies that the forecast value in the OUTFOR= data set be set to missing when a corresponding historical value is missing.

arguments.name: REPLACEMISSING
arguments.description: Specifies that embedded missing actual values be replaced with one-step-ahead forecasts in the OUT= data set. The inverse behavior of this option, applied to the OUTFOR= data set, is NOREPLACE.

arguments.name: SETMISSING=
arguments.description: Specifies how missing values (either actual or accumulated) are assigned in the accumulated time series for variables listed in the FORECAST statement.
arguments.help: SETMISSING=MISSING | AVERAGE | MINIMUM | MEDIAN | MAXIMUM | FIRST | LAST | PREVIOUS | NEXT

arguments.name: RIGHT

statements.name: ID
statements.description: The ID statement names a numeric variable that identifies observations in the input and output data sets. The ID variableâ€™s values are assumed to be SAS date, time, or datetime values. In addition, the ID statement specifies the (desired) frequency associated with the actual time series. The ID statement options also specify how the observations are accumulated and how the time ID values are aligned to form the actual time series. The information specified affects all variables specified in subsequent FORECAST statements. If the ID statement is specified, the INTERVAL= option must also be specified. If an ID statement is not specified, the observation number (with respect to the BY group) is used as the time ID.

arguments.name: ACCUMULATE=
arguments.description: Specifies how the data set observations are accumulated within each time period.
arguments.help: ACCUMULATE=NONE | TOTAL | AVERAGE | MINIMUM | MEDIAN | MAXIMUM | N | NMISS | NOBS | FIRST | LAST | STDDEV | CSS | USS*option*

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: No accumulation occurs; the ID variable values must be equally spaced with respect to the frequency. This is the default option.

arguments.name: TOTAL
arguments.description: Observations are accumulated based on the total sum of their values.

arguments.name: AVERAGE
arguments.description: Observations are accumulated based on the average of their values.

arguments.name: MINIMUM
arguments.description: Observations are accumulated based on the minimum of their values.

arguments.name: MEDIAN
arguments.description: Observations are accumulated based on the median of their values.

arguments.name: MAXIMUM
arguments.description: Observations are accumulated based on the maximum of their values.

arguments.name: N
arguments.description: Observations are accumulated based on the number of nonmissing observations.

arguments.name: NMISS
arguments.description: Observations are accumulated based on the number of missing observations.

arguments.name: NOBS
arguments.description: Observations are accumulated based on the number of observations.

arguments.name: FIRST
arguments.description: Observations are accumulated based on the first of their values.

arguments.name: LAST
arguments.description: Observations are accumulated based on the last of their values.

arguments.name: STDDEV
arguments.description: Observations are accumulated based on the standard deviation of their values.

arguments.name: CSS
arguments.description: Observations are accumulated based on the corrected sum of squares of their values.

arguments.name: USS
arguments.description: Observations are accumulated based on the uncorrected sum of squares of their values.

arguments.name: ALIGN=
arguments.description: Controls the alignment of SAS dates that are used to identify output observations.

arguments.name: BEGINNING
arguments.description: Beginning

arguments.name: MIDDLE
arguments.description: Middle

arguments.name: ENDING
arguments.description: Ending

arguments.name: END=
arguments.description: Specifies a SAS date, datetime, or time value that represents the end of the data. If the last time ID variable value is less than the END= value, the series is extended with missing values.

arguments.name: FORMAT=
arguments.description: Specifies a SAS format that is used for the DATE variable in the output data sets. The default format is the same as that of the DATE variable in the DATA= data set.

arguments.name: HORIZONSTART=
arguments.description: Specifies a SAS date, datetime, or time value that represents the start of the forecast horizon.

arguments.name: INTERVAL=
arguments.description: Specifies the frequency of the input time series.

arguments.name: SETMISSING=
arguments.description: Specifies how missing values (either actual or accumulated) are assigned in the accumulated time series.
arguments.help: SETMISSING=MISSING | AVERAGE | MINIMUM | MEDIAN | MAXIMUM | FIRST | LAST | PREVIOUS | NEXT

arguments.name: MISSING
arguments.description: Missing values are set to missing. This is the default option.

arguments.name: AVERAGE
arguments.description: Missing values are set to the accumulated average value.

arguments.name: MINIMUM
arguments.description: Missing values are set to the accumulated minimum value.

arguments.name: MEDIAN
arguments.description: Missing values are set to the accumulated median value.

arguments.name: MAXIMUM
arguments.description: Missing values are set to the accumulated maximum value.

arguments.name: FIRST
arguments.description: Missing values are set to the accumulated first nonmissing value.

arguments.name: LAST
arguments.description: Missing values are set to the accumulated last nonmissing value.

arguments.name: PREVIOUS
arguments.description: Missing values are set to the previous accumulated nonmissing value.

arguments.name: NEXT
arguments.description: Missing values are set to the next accumulated nonmissing value.

arguments.name: START=
arguments.description: Specifies a SAS date, datetime, or time value that represents the beginning of the data.

arguments.name: TRIMMISS=
arguments.description: Specifies how missing values (either actual or accumulated) are trimmed from the accumulated time series for variables listed in the FORECAST statement.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: No missing value trimming is applied.

arguments.name: LEFT
arguments.description: Beginning missing values are trimmed.

arguments.name: RIGHT
arguments.description: Ending missing values are trimmed.

arguments.name: BOTH
arguments.description: Both beginning and ending missing value are trimmed.

arguments.name: ZEROMISS=
arguments.description: Specifies how beginning and/or ending zero values (either actual or accumulated) are interpreted in the accumulated time series.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: Beginning and/or ending zeros unchanged.

arguments.name: LEFT
arguments.description: Beginning zeros are set to missing.

arguments.name: RIGHT
arguments.description: Ending zeros are set to missing.

arguments.name: BOTH
arguments.description: Both beginning and ending zeros are set to missing.

statements.name: INPUT
statements.description: The INPUT statement lists the numeric variables in the DATA= data set whose accumulated values are used as deterministic input in the forecasting process.
statements.help: INPUT <ACCUMULATE=<NONE | TOTAL | AVERAGE|AVG>... > <REQUIRED=<YES | NO>> <SETMISSING=<MISSING | AVERAGE|AVG | MINIMUM|MIN>... > ...

arguments.name: ACCUMULATE=
arguments.description: Specifies how the data set observations are accumulated within each time period for the variables listed in the INPUT statement.
arguments.help: ACCUMULATE=NONE | TOTAL | AVERAGE | MINIMUM | MEDIAN | MAXIMUM | N | NMISS | NOBS | FIRST | LAST | STDDEV | CSS | USS*option*

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: None

arguments.name: TOTAL
arguments.description: Total

arguments.name: AVERAGE
arguments.description: Average

arguments.name: MINIMUM
arguments.description: Minimum

arguments.name: MEDIAN

arguments.name: FIRST
arguments.description: First

arguments.name: LAST
arguments.description: Last

arguments.name: STDDEV

arguments.name: CSS
arguments.description: CSS

arguments.name: USS
arguments.description: USS

arguments.name: REQUIRED=
arguments.description: Enables or disables a check of inputs to models.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: Specifies that the input variables be included in the model as long as the model does not fail to be diagnosed.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: Specifies that the input variables be included in the model as long as their parameters are significant and the increment of the value of criterion exceeds a threshold.

arguments.name: SETMISSING=
arguments.description: Specifies how missing values (either actual or accumulated) are assigned in the accumulated time series for the variables listed in the INPUT statement.
arguments.help: SETMISSING=MISSING | AVERAGE | MINIMUM | MEDIAN | MAXIMUM | FIRST | LAST | PREVIOUS | NEXT

arguments.name: MISSING
arguments.description: Missing

arguments.name: AVERAGE
arguments.description: Average

arguments.name: MINIMUM
arguments.description: Minimum

arguments.name: MEDIAN
arguments.description: Median

arguments.name: MAXIMUM
arguments.description: Maximum

arguments.name: FIRST
arguments.description: First

arguments.name: LAST
arguments.description: Last

arguments.name: PREVIOUS
arguments.description: Previous

arguments.name: NEXT
arguments.description: Next

arguments.name: TRIMMISS=
arguments.description: Specifies how missing values (either actual or accumulated) are trimmed from the accumulated time series for variables listed in the INPUT statement.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: No missing value trimming is applied.

arguments.name: LEFT
arguments.description: Beginning missing values are trimmed.

arguments.name: RIGHT
arguments.description: Ending missing values are trimmed.

arguments.name: BOTH
arguments.description: Both beginning and ending missing value are trimmed.

arguments.name: ZEROMISS=
arguments.description: Specifies how beginning and/or ending zero values (either actual or accumulated) are interpreted in the accumulated time series for variables listed in the INPUT statement.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: Beginning and/or ending zeros unchanged.

arguments.name: LEFT
arguments.description: Beginning zeros are set to missing.

arguments.name: RIGHT
arguments.description: Ending zeros are set to missing.

arguments.name: BOTH
arguments.description: Both beginning and ending zeros are set to missing.

statements.name: SCORE
statements.description: The SCORE statement, used in conjunction with one or more FORECAST statements, causes the generation of score files.

arguments.name: BASENAME=
arguments.description: Prefixes the score file name with the specified value.

statements.name: STOCHASTIC
statements.description: The STOCHASTIC statement lists the numeric variables in the DATA= data set whose accumulated values are used as stochastic input in the forecasting process.
statements.help: STOCHASTIC <ACCUMULATE=<NONE | TOTAL | AVERAGE|AVG>... > <REQUIRED=<YES | NO>> <SELECTION=<NONE | TOTAL | AVERAGE|AVG>... > ...

arguments.name: ACCUMULATE=
arguments.description: Specifies how the data set observations are accumulated within each time period for the variables listed in the STOCHASTIC statement.
arguments.help: ACCUMULATE=NONE | TOTAL | AVERAGE | MINIMUM | MEDIAN | MAXIMUM | N | NMISS | NOBS | FIRST | LAST | STDDEV | CSS | USS*option*

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: No accumulation occurs; the ID variable values must be equally spaced with respect to the frequency. This is the default option.

arguments.name: TOTAL
arguments.description: Observations are accumulated based on the total sum of their values.

arguments.name: AVERAGE
arguments.description: Observations are accumulated based on the average of their values.

arguments.name: MINIMUM
arguments.description: Observations are accumulated based on the minimum of their values.

arguments.name: MEDIAN
arguments.description: Observations are accumulated based on the median of their values.

arguments.name: MAXIMUM
arguments.description: Observations are accumulated based on the maximum of their values.

arguments.name: N
arguments.description: Observations are accumulated based on the number of nonmissing observations.

arguments.name: NMISS
arguments.description: Observations are accumulated based on the number of missing observations.

arguments.name: NOBS
arguments.description: Observations are accumulated based on the number of observations.

arguments.name: FIRST
arguments.description: Observations are accumulated based on the first of their values.

arguments.name: LAST
arguments.description: Observations are accumulated based on the last of their values.

arguments.name: STDDEV
arguments.description: Observations are accumulated based on the standard deviation of their values.

arguments.name: CSS
arguments.description: Observations are accumulated based on the corrected sum of squares of their values.

arguments.name: USS
arguments.description: Observations are accumulated based on the uncorrected sum of squares of their values.

arguments.name: REPLACEMISSING
arguments.description: Specifies that embedded missing actual values be replaced with one-step-ahead forecasts in the STOCHASTIC variables.

arguments.name: REQUIRED=
arguments.description: Enables or disables a check of inputs to models.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: Checks are not performed and no inputs are dropped from a model.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: Inputs are checked and those with errors, or those judged collinear, are dropped from the model for the current series and task only.

arguments.name: SELECTION=
arguments.description: Specifies the selection list used to forecast the stochastic variables.
arguments.help: SELECTION=NONE | TOTAL | AVERAGE | MINIMUM | MEDIAN | MAXIMUM | N | NMISS | NOBS | FIRST | LAST | STDDEV | CSS | USS*option*

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: No accumulation occurs; the ID variable values must be equally spaced with respect to the frequency. This is the default option.

arguments.name: TOTAL
arguments.description: Observations are accumulated based on the total sum of their values.

arguments.name: AVERAGE
arguments.description: Observations are accumulated based on the average of their values.

arguments.name: MINIMUM
arguments.description: Observations are accumulated based on the minimum of their values.

arguments.name: MEDIAN
arguments.description: Observations are accumulated based on the median of their values.

arguments.name: MAXIMUM
arguments.description: Observations are accumulated based on the maximum of their values.

arguments.name: N
arguments.description: Observations are accumulated based on the number of nonmissing observations.

arguments.name: NMISS
arguments.description: Observations are accumulated based on the number of missing observations.

arguments.name: NOBS
arguments.description: Observations are accumulated based on the number of observations.

arguments.name: FIRST
arguments.description: Observations are accumulated based on the first of their values.

arguments.name: LAST
arguments.description: Observations are accumulated based on the last of their values.

arguments.name: STDDEV
arguments.description: Observations are accumulated based on the standard deviation of their values.

arguments.name: CSS
arguments.description: Observations are accumulated based on the corrected sum of squares of their values.

arguments.name: USS
arguments.description: Observations are accumulated based on the uncorrected sum of squares of their values.

arguments.name: SETMISSING=
arguments.description: Specifies how missing values (either actual or accumulated) are assigned in the accumulated time series.
arguments.help: SETMISSING=MISSING | AVERAGE | MINIMUM | MEDIAN | MAXIMUM | FIRST | LAST | PREVIOUS | NEXT

arguments.name: MISSING
arguments.description: Missing values are set to missing. This is the default option.

arguments.name: AVERAGE
arguments.description: Observations are accumulated based on the average of their values.

arguments.name: MINIMUM
arguments.description: Missing values are set to the accumulated minimum value.

arguments.name: MEDIAN
arguments.description: Missing values are set to the accumulated median value.

arguments.name: MAXIMUM
arguments.description: Missing values are set to the accumulated maximum value.

arguments.name: FIRST
arguments.description: Missing values are set to the accumulated first nonmissing value.

arguments.name: LAST
arguments.description: Missing values are set to the accumulated last nonmissing value.

arguments.name: PREVIOUS
arguments.description: Missing values are set to the previous accumulated nonmissing value.

arguments.name: NEXT
arguments.description: Missing values are set to the next accumulated nonmissing value.

arguments.name: TRIMMISS=
arguments.description: Specifies how missing values (either actual or accumulated) are trimmed from the accumulated time series for variables listed in the FORECAST statement.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: No missing value trimming is applied.

arguments.name: LEFT
arguments.description: Beginning missing values are trimmed.

arguments.name: RIGHT
arguments.description: Ending missing values are trimmed.

arguments.name: BOTH
arguments.description: Both beginning and ending missing value are trimmed.

arguments.name: ZEROMISS=
arguments.description: Specifies how beginning and/or ending zero values (either actual or accumulated) are interpreted in the accumulated time series.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: Beginning and/or ending zeros unchanged.

arguments.name: LEFT
arguments.description: Beginning zeros are set to missing.

arguments.name: RIGHT
arguments.description: Ending zeros are set to missing.

arguments.name: BOTH
arguments.description: Both beginning and ending zeros are set to missing.
